title: Pinnacles National Park: Ferns
body: Ferns       The dry climate of Pinnacles may seem like an unlikely place for ferns to grow. During the summer months, deep canyons provide shade for moisture-loving species, such as maidenhair and horsetail ferns. Other species, such as the bird's-foot and coffee ferns, tolerate dry conditions.                    Fern Photo Gallery   16 Photos  Photos of Pinnacles ferns, arranged alphabetically by family scientific name.                        For more information about ferns and other plant species at Pinnacles National Park, visit our Digital Herbarium.
